Class ExchangeRate

java.lang.Object
ExchangeRate
public class ExchangeRate extends Object
Utility class for converting monetary values between currencies.

Currency conversion is performed using predefined, static exchange rates. These values do not reflect real market fluctuations or banking commissions.

Supported currencies:

  • RON
  • EUR
  • USD

Supported exchange pairs and rates: 

 RON â†’ EUR = Ã· 5.0
 EUR â†’ RON = Ã— 5.0

 RON â†’ USD = Ã· 4.7
 USD â†’ RON = Ã— 4.7

 EUR â†’ USD = Ã— 1.07
 USD â†’ EUR = Ã· 1.07

Example: 

 double eur = ExchangeRate.convert(100, "RON", "EUR");
 double usd = ExchangeRate.convert(50, "EUR", "USD");

    • convert

      public static double convert(double amount, String from, String to)
      Converts a given monetary amount from one currency to another using predefined static rates.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount to convert (must be â‰¥ 0)
      from - source currency (e.g., "RON")
      to - target currency (e.g., "EUR")
      Returns:
      the converted value in the target currency
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if amount < 0 or either currency code is invalid
      RuntimeException - if the conversion pair is unsupported
